meanings.sent1: The plasmic glow of the neon sign caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the plasmic state of matter in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The plasmic screen on the new TV made colors look extra vibrant.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like a plasmic energy that fueled the team.
meanings.sent5: The plasmic waves in the sky created a mesmerizing light show.

meanings.sent1: The plasmic cloud in space was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The plasmic fluid inside the experiment chamber glowed brightly.
meanings.sent3: The plasmic drink was a hit at the party, glowing under the blacklight.
meanings.sent4: The plasmic energy source powered the entire facility.
meanings.sent5: The plasmic explosion lit up the night sky with its fiery display.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the protoplasm of a cell.
meanings.sent1: The plasmic structure of the cell membrane was crucial for its function.
meanings.sent2: The biologist observed the plasmic movements within the cell.
meanings.sent3: The plasmic dance of the organelles was like a microscopic ballet.
meanings.sent4: The plasmic connections between cells allowed for efficient communication.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the plasmic world of cells was a fascinating sight.
